Key Arguments: The legislation could lead to censorship of everyday Australians, stifling free speech and open discussion.
The bill is seen as a step towards dictatorship, reminiscent of authoritarian regimes' control over information.
There is concern over who will oversee the implementation of the legislation and the potential for abuse of power.
The legislation could suppress diverse voices and promote a single narrative, which is detrimental to democracy.
There is a lack of safety mechanisms to prevent misuse of the legislation by those with ulterior motives.
Notable Quotes: This Bill puts us on a one-way road to dictatorship.
It is reminiscent of the 'Ministry of Truth' from dictatorships past.
We do not want propaganda to thrive, we need all voices not just one voice.
